column4: Musk says 'thorough reorganization' underway at Tesla
column5: WASHINGTON Tesla Inc  chief Elon Musk told employees on Monday the company was undergoing a "thorough reorganization" as it contends with production problems  senior staff departures and recent crashes involving its electric cars. | Video

column4: Tesla registers Shanghai electric car firm ahead of ownership rule change
column5: SHANGHAI Tesla Inc  has registered a new electric car firm in Shanghai  as China prepares to scrap rules on capping foreign ownership of new-energy vehicle (NEV) ventures.

column4: Tesla registers Shanghai electric car firm ahead of ownership rule change
column5: SHANGHAI  May 14 Tesla Inc has registered a new electric car firm in Shanghai  as China prepares to scrap rules on capping foreign ownership of new-energy vehicle (NEV) ventures.

column4: PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - May 14
column5: May 14 The following are the top stories in the Wall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: NXP shares jump after report China resumes Qualcomm deal review
column5: NXP Semiconductors NV's  shares jumped as much as 11.7 percent on Monday after a report that China has resumed review of U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc's  proposed $44 billion buyout of the Dutch semiconductor company.

column4: UPDATE 7-Trump defends intervention to help China telecom company ZTE
column5: WASHINGTON  May 14 President Donald Trump on Monday defended his decision to revisit penalties for Chinese company ZTE Corp for flouting U.S. sanctions on trade with Iran  saying the telecom maker is a big buyer for U.S. suppliers.

column4: UPDATE 2-NXP shares jump after report China resumes Qualcomm deal review
column5: May 14 NXP Semiconductors NV's shares jumped as much as 11.7 percent on Monday after a report that China has resumed review of U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc's proposed $44 billion buyout of the Dutch semiconductor company.

column4: In concession  Trump will help China's ZTE 'get back into business'
column5: WASHINGTON/BEIJING U.S. President Donald Trump pledged on Sunday to help ZTE Corp "get back into business  fast" after a U.S. ban crippled the Chinese technology company  offering a job-saving concession to Beijing ahead of high-stakes trade talks this week. | Video

column4: Trump's comments on China's ZTE draw security concerns
column5: WASHINGTON  May 14 President Donald Trump's pledge to help China's ZTE Corp "get back into business  fast" and save Chinese jobs after a U.S. ban crippled the technology company drew condemnation from some lawmakers on Monday over trade and security concerns.
BEIJING  May 14 China has resumed its review of U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc's proposed $44 billion takeover of NXP Semiconductors NV  Bloomberg reported on Monday  citing unidentified sources.
